description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ejbn","text":"Overview","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38bqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3g0v","text":"Microbes resistant to antimicrobial agents are a major worldwide health challenge. Rapid detection of antimicrobial resistant pathogens and surveillance efforts are critical. Information about antimicrobial resistance (AMR) genes is available in databases, and quantitative PCR (qPCR) has been proven suitable for detecting AMR genes (Abram et al. 2019; Galhano et al. 2021; Wu et al. 2022). In this research session, we will use the epMotion 5075 and a custom 3D-printed adapter to leverage the power of automation and the new QIAGEN QIAcuity Digital PCR system to detect and quantify a target antimicrobial resistance gene in metagenomic DNA samples from soils and compost. Take a virtual tour of the QIAcuity that we will be using for our research!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":193,"length":36},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":703,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":703,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"fgvmh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd60b","text":"Digital PCR (dPCR) allows for absolute quantification of template DNA or RNA molecules based on Poisson statistics. But, what does that mean and how does dPCR even work? Read about the fundamentals of dPCR in these articles and watch this short video about dPCR: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29fh6","text":"Read Digital PCR for beginners","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"bce2q","text":"Read Fundamentals of Digital PCR","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":5,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"44ef7","text":"Watch Principles of dPCR Explained","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":6,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":6,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"2mfv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jegu","text":"During our second research session, we will set up the epMotion 5075 to dilute metagenomic DNA samples. We will set up dPCR by combining a commercial PCR master mix (includes: dNTPs, polymerase, buffers, Mg2+,water) with our research specific primers, probes, and diluted DNA template to carefully pipette into a QIAGEN Nanoplate with partitions for use in the QIAcuity. We will run dPCR on AMR genes from a mixed population of soil microbes to investigate whether soils used as our samples contain microbes with AMR genes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":320,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":320,"length":9}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DF4038FC77C11ED98020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/applications/digital-pcr/workflow/qiacuity-demo"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DF403BBC77C11ED98020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/applications/digital-pcr/beginners"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DF403EDC77C11ED98020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/knowledge-and-support/knowledge-hub/bench-guide/pcr/digital-pcr/what-is-digital-pcr"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DF40323C77C11ED98020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://qiagen-marketing.videomarketingplatform.co/secret/68126801/2a53b222c351d6de43de15f8f8cb5a52?%25253F=edit"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6DF40361C77C11ED98020A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/instruments-and-automation/accessories/qiacuity-nanoplates-and-accessories"}}}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"br7aa","text":"Obtain soil and compost samples from different environments. We have access to soil and compost samples from Christopher Hopkins from efforts to learn about the composting process of “swine lagoon” sludge and have dried and “tar-like” samples. Your instructors (Horton and Phillips) also prepared solid metagenomic DNA samples from around the campus for comparison.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7h8gc","text":"Weigh   into QIAGEN PowerSoil Pro bead beating tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1eitm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"74C79740C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83p5p","text":"Extract DNA following the QIAGEN PowerSoil Pro protocol in triplicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq6k4","text":"Elute in   5 of CD6 Elution buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13gm8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"891D6E90C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1kqan","text":"Quantify DNA by NanoDrop and use the Qubit BR DNA kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9krbh","text":"Run    of sample on Agilent TapeStation using the Genomic DNA tape and reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d6af4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8llq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gtc6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq09r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"99D1B520C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cg247","text":"The first six steps have been performed by your instructors in preparation for our lab session. Metagenomic DNA preparation will allow us to focus on the setup and automation of a plate full of genomic samples. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etf3r","text":"Obtain    Forward and    Reverse Primer for the blaCTX-M-1 antimicrobial resistance gene. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"954ig","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.8","error_concentration":false,"guid":"BC7C5F30C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.8","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C7417B80C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9s9s","text":"Obtain probe     and dilute it with    of TE Buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bq6ea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.4","error_concentration":false,"guid":"D9D83DB0C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"625","error":false,"guid":"E1912B70C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4oe1","text":"Transfer   1 of diluted probe into tubes via pipette in a biosafety hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42o3b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"EB0D4D00C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5s2c9","text":"Transfer   of buffer solution with   of both the reverse and forward primers, and    of the probe to make the primer probe mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6g18p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"F8414670C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"FEBD4760C6AE11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"03BDF2F0C6AF11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29fpm","text":"The primer probe mix,   of the master mix, and    of the restriction EcoRI enzyme per reaction were dispensed into the PCR plate. Then, the extracted compost DNA was added to each well that contained the overall reaction mix (   per reaction)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":226,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5p6a4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"122B56C0C6AF11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.15","error":false,"guid":"18D56C90C6AF11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"1E82F9F0C6AF11ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jst0","text":"Transfer mixtures from the PCR plate to the QIAGEN Nanoplate (96 wells, 8.5k partitions) using the epMotion 5075. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7imtg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15v8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akohg","text":"Seal the Nanoplate properly with the provided seal and use roller to ensure proper seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5dls","text":"Transfer the plate to the QIAcuity instrument, remove the white plate tray, and load into the digital PCR using a template for a full plate with a FAM-based probe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnrbl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhoej","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bk6fm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CB60366C6B211EDAB840A58A9FEAC02","height":"383","id":"1D3BCC90C6B211ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"ceubl\",\"text\":\"Figure 3. Schematic of the thermocycling steps with a probe with fluorophore and quencher. Metagenomic template DNA (step 1) is denatured (step 2) to initiate the thermocycling procedure. Primer annealing (step 3) and extension (step 4) occur at the same temperature. Fluorescence is detected after the fluorescent reporter is released from the bound probe. Diagram created with BioRender.com\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":90}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/hitjrqVoQHANncOTsRweCMjBU_oCWyxtirZCpqdCOMWantLc_8UjfUiTqyndRmvfqOPkiBdOyOtEy-PcGcvjYKHnIcoi5jDFgExfQBqnBvfdumEa3PveZklWB1BVncFYYVjHP8u3re1xVolRJvqDa0Y","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/hitjrqVoQHANncOTsRweCMjBU_oCWyxtirZCpqdCOMWantLc_8UjfUiTqyndRmvfqOPkiBdOyOtEy-PcGcvjYKHnIcoi5jDFgExfQBqnBvfdumEa3PveZklWB1BVncFYYVjHP8u3re1xVolRJvqDa0Y","width":"624"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rgs2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkjn3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ujd1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9clb5","text":"Expected Results ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eenct","text":"We expect to detect AMR sequences in most samples and be able to detect a decreasing number of positive partitions as samples are diluted (left to right) across the plate. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vhs5n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"48819289C6B211EDAB840A58A9FEAC02","height":"353","id":"4907A6F0C6B211ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"ljg1\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. Schematic of procedure to use liquid handler to seed plates with samples and digital PCR master mix. The epMotion 5075 is usedto set up a master mix for digital PCR by combining the QIAcuity mix, ultra clean water, forward and reverse primers/probe (Table 1) and EcoRI HF restriction enzyme according to Tables 2. In Step 2, the master mix is distributed to a 96-well PCR plate and genomic DNA is diluted and transferred to the PCR plate. A ten-minute incubation at 22 °C is started to allow the EcoRI enzyme to digest large pieces of DNA for mobility in the Nanoplate. In Step 4, the reactions are transferred to a QIAGEN Nanoplate placed on the custom Nanoplate adapter. In Step 5, the QIAcuity digital PCR is loaded with the sealed Nanoplate from Step 4. Thermocycling conditions (listed in Table 3) are followed before data is downloaded to analyze in Step 5. Created with BioRender.com\",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":110},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":260,\"length\":7},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":314,\"length\":8},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":804,\"length\":7}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/IjTrIxk7c0RNOv36BMiQP7Q-XVhuIZf-tVfMphRc1-rC5mGKq36yBLb2-HdyfH5-JeJ0e5tMy7XOS1ypUYt6t1Sv9jktIEagIL7aDmPVA4lDQnX0E2hoNjt5aBeQE17bnwPVy57AorlXCOy4-llFZw4","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/IjTrIxk7c0RNOv36BMiQP7Q-XVhuIZf-tVfMphRc1-rC5mGKq36yBLb2-HdyfH5-JeJ0e5tMy7XOS1ypUYt6t1Sv9jktIEagIL7aDmPVA4lDQnX0E2hoNjt5aBeQE17bnwPVy57AorlXCOy4-llFZw4","width":"624"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chl28","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"577727C8C6B211EDAB840A58A9FEAC02","height":"383","id":"57FD2680C6B211ED8F4773D0F7C62BE2","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"56l80\",\"text\":\"Figure 2. Dilution of metagenomic DNA samples from replicate extractions. Metagenomic DNA from replicate DNA extractions is diluted before using as a template for digital PCR. One microliter for each of eight metagenomic DNA samples in 1.5 ml tubes is transferred to the first column of a 96-well. The epMotion liquid handler is used to transfer ultra clean water to the remaining wells and perform two-fold dilutions from columns 2 through 12. One microliter of each well is then transferred to the PCR plate with the digital PCR master mix. Image created with BioRender.com.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":73}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"5a1sc\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"3eu1j\",\"text\":\"As a group, we will use a common script and the liquid handler to prepare sets of plates for analyses. Each bay will set up one plate.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/pbBlsmNtCaDhl7qecnSZE9WcO0YtjuLMvRyZzPwb0kUqarFY6yLeka8Btce--rtXC3DaxWx25vaIdF_woVfdeBiQqMZ3zQEUFje8yoE7Z0IC2PHZYF8YxdJ4tjwG3IiLgBsdAm3RLDbYHx_LqyEeMFo","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/pbBlsmNtCaDhl7qecnSZE9WcO0YtjuLMvRyZzPwb0kUqarFY6yLeka8Btce--rtXC3DaxWx25vaIdF_woVfdeBiQqMZ3zQEUFje8yoE7Z0IC2PHZYF8YxdJ4tjwG3IiLgBsdAm3RLDbYHx_LqyEeMFo","width":"624"}}}}

title: AMR Detection by dPCR
